snippet: Pentagon officials said that while a surveillance drone targeted in international airspace over the Persian Gulf last week was not hit, the incident prompted a strong protest to Tehran.
abstract: Pentagon says Iranian warplanes shot at an American military surveillance drone flying over the Persian Gulf in international airspace near Iran, but it was not hit; shooting prompts strong protest to Iranian government.

byline.original: By THOM SHANKER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Thom Shanker reported from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Mark Landler contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Pentagon officials said that while a surveillance drone targeted in international airspace over the Persian Gulf last week was not hit, the incident prompted a strong protest to Tehran.

headline.main: Iran Fired on Military Drone in First Such Attack, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Iran Fired on Military Drone In First Such Attack, U.S. Says

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
